reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The Middle East and North Africa (MENA) as a region continues to face turmoil through regional power politics, failing states, diverse armed groups, increased sectarianism, transnational jihadism, economic strain and refugees fleeing the violence. At the n ational level, regimes are increasingly using means of coercion to reassert control. Due to the regions closely interlinked political and economic contexts, the result is widespread corruption and cronyism which continues to impede sustainable economic gro wth. Women face particular challenges and increased vulnerability, particularly in conflict affected countries that have seen the rise of extremist groups. The impact of regional instability is also felt internationally, particularly in Europe where local conflicts in Libya, Syria, Iraq and Yemen create significant policy challenges in the areas of migration and energy security. The current regional mechanisms in place to promote dialogue and cooperation in the MENA region are inadequate for the current int ernationalization of conflict. To make national dialogues sustainable and implementable we need to develop new systematic approaches to sustainable, effective and inclusive dialogue at the regional level.#CMI works in the MENA region to enhance the prospec ts for the development of improved peace and security to prevent and address conflicts on a regional level. As part of this, CMI seeks to increase channels between relevant regional actors on regional security issues, advance informal regional security dia logue on key areas of regional instability, and increase exchanges between experts on how confidence building mechanisms could be effectively developed to support regional peace and security dialogue.
